message: We have only 5 or 6 talks submitted right now. We need to start pushing a little harder I think.
Yikes. Is this similar to previous years just before the deadline?
We had 12 by this point last year, we received 5 the day before the deadline and 8 on the last day. We also allow 3 late proposals so that we could have a full schedule.
One idea to help fill content is to have a room dedicated to playing talks from other Python Conferences. Maybe have some sort of voting system in place to determine what gets shown.
Almost done getting the proposals in the system. (It's a little more painful this year) Once that is done we'll be able to see where we are.
There are 3 on their way that had issues on the website and there are 20 currently in the system. This is probably just enough.
With Memorial week, there might be a few late proposals, and I'll try to round up a few more submissions in the next day or two.
@issackelly stills fails to submit proposals, but doesn't say what's wrong - entering them directly in the admin works though
